version_description:
- New: Save your favorites, plus organize them into Collections for easy viewing and sharing
- Other bug fixes and improvements

- Improved share dialog
- Bug fixes and performance improvements
Bug fixes.
Fixes problem when displaying landscape projects on iPad.

- New: Find museums and cultural events near my location
- Other bug fixes and improvements

- Improved iPad compatibility
- New navigation bar
- Other design improvements and bug fixes

- New: launching Google Arts & Culture Experiments
- Improved VR navigation

- Localisation improvements
- Bug fixes

Subscribe to Notifications for updates on the latest arts & culture stories.
Landscape mode now available on all devices.
Bugfixes and minor improvements
Bugfixes and minor improvements

• Take a selfie and discover if your portrait is in a museum.
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

• Take a selfie and discover if your portrait is in a museum. (Select locations only)
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

• Bug fixes and minor improvements.
• Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.

• Bug fixes and minor improvements.
• Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.

• Add stories and themes to your Favorites.
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.

See culture through a new lens. You’ll now have quick access to all the ways you can explore art using your camera:
• Art Selfie: Discover portraits that look like you
• Color Palette: Find art by using the colors of your photo
• Art Projector: See how artworks look in real size
• Pocket Gallery: View all of Vermeer’s artworks together in an immersive exhibition

• Add stories and themes to your Favourites.
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the US. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.
• Fresh new icons and stability fixes

• Browse local landmarks in paintings & photos using the Nearby map.
• Improvements for VoiceOver support.
• Support for iPhone X.
• Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.

• Browse local landmarks in paintings & photos using the Nearby map.
• Improvements for VoiceOver support.
• Support for iPhone X.
• Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.

• View paintings in AR: Use augmented reality to see real-size artworks in front of you.
• Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Brazil, Canada, India, Japan, Korea, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.

• View paintings in AR: Use augmented reality to see real-size artworks in front of you.
• Search with your selfie: Now available in Australia, Brazil, Canada, India, Japan, Korea, New Zealand, Singapore and parts of the U.S. Stay tuned as we try to improve and expand this experiment.
• Art Selfie - A playful way to discover art. Now available globally.
Layout improvements and bug fixes for Art Selfie
Dive into an immersive gallery with all of Vermeers artworks, brought together for the first time
Dive into an immersive gallery with all of Vermeers artworks, brought together for the first time

See culture through a new lens. You’ll now have quick access to all the ways you can explore art using your camera:
• Art Selfie: Discover portraits that look like you
• Color Palette: Find art by using the colors of your photo
• Art Projector: See how artworks look in real size
• Pocket Gallery: View all of Vermeer’s artworks together in an immersive exhibition
• Fresh new icons and stability fixes
• Try the newest Pocket Gallery - The Art of Color
• Now supports Arabic and Hebrew
• Now supports Arabic and Hebrew

• Art Transfer – Can you recognize the artists behind iconic styles? (Re)discover artworks from famous artists like Frida Kahlo, Keith Haring or Katsushika Hokusai. Tap the camera icon and get inspired by Art Transfer.

• Art Transfer – Can you recognize the artists behind iconic styles? (Re)discover artworks from famous artists like Frida Kahlo, Keith Haring or Katsushika Hokusai. Tap the camera icon and get inspired by Art Transfer.

• Record videos and take photos of artworks in your space using Art Projector
• Play games created by the Google Arts & Culture Experiments team:
- Puzzle Party: Solve artistic jigsaw puzzles together with family and friends
- Visual Crosswords: Discover more art through unexpected pairings
- Cultural Crosswords: Get cultured through word puzzles
- What Came First? : Compare cultural moments in time
- Art Coloring Book: Color your way through the palettes of famous paintings
• Cast artworks on your TV and zoom in to brushstroke-level detail
• Cast artworks on your TV and zoom in to brushstroke-level detail
• Art Filter — The most famous pearl earring, a Samurai helmet, an iconic Van Gogh self-portrait and more: try on new filters based on artifacts from museums by tapping the camera icon.
• Art Filter — The most famous pearl earring, a Samurai helmet, an iconic Van Gogh self-portrait and more: try on new filters based on artifacts from museums by tapping the camera icon.
• Art Filter — The most famous pearl earring, a Samurai helmet, an iconic Van Gogh self-portrait and more: try on new filters based on artifacts from museums by tapping the camera icon.
Bug fixes and minor improvements.

Travel the globe with 3 new Pocket Gallery virtual exhibitions. Tap the camera button to get started.
• Brushes with the World: The first Pocket Gallery with guided audio narration, taking you around the world through art and sound
• Better Together: Explore social gatherings in art through works by Renoir, Manet, Rousseau, and more from the Getty’s collection
• From Africa to Japan: Contemporary Japanese and African artworks from the Jean Pigozzi Collection

• New style sets in Art Transfer to transform your photos using iconic artworks, from contemporary art to classic portraits
• Unlock badge achievements by exploring interactive camera features
